medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported primary amenorrhea, which was evaluated at age 16 and diagnosed as congenital absence of the uterus and ovaries. She experienced linear growth spurt and normal adrenarche and thelarche at approximately 12 years of age. No menstrual molimina, headaches, vision problems, galactorrhea, vasomotor symptoms, or reduction in exercise tolerance were reported. Earlier, at age 10, she fractured her arm and underwent tonsillectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital absence of the uterus and ovaries diagnosed at age 16. Previous fractured arm and tonsillectomy at age 10.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had an easy conception and underwent hysterectomy for endometriosis at age 46. Maternal grandfather died of myocardial infarction at age 70. The patient's father and two sisters are healthy; one sister is a fraternal twin with regular menses.
medical_history.social_history: Currently lives with her husband, moved to New England from northern Europe four months prior, works in an office, drinks alcohol rarely, smokes 3 to 5 cigarettes a day, and does not use illicit drugs.
